intro: Didissandra humilis, commonly known as the dwarf sandalwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
